entry.title: A Movie Date
entry.summary:
Author: NoodleDragon324

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,469Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 62

Summary: While tackling what seems to be the biggest case of kidnapping ever seen, Superman and Batman find themselves trapped in the plot of a cheesy holiday romance movie.Clark, now playing a man who returns to his small town at Christmas to take over his family business, which is unfortunately under the threat of seizure, and Bruce as the guy in charge of collecting the store for the bank, have to find a way to escape this fictional Christmas town while being railroaded on the worst(best?) romance plot of their lives.

entry.title: Space love
entry.summary:
Author: Speechless_since_1998

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,593Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 315

Summary: "It means that a dangerous criminal has taken refuge on your planet, and currently his plans are unknown."It wasn't Hal Jordan who spoke, nor one of the other Lanterns. Instead, it was a man a little younger than Batman who appeared behind the Green Lanterns, dressed in a blue and red suit, with a cloak on which there was a pin to stop him from the characteristic S-shape.The man's eyes were blue, not Bruce's icy color, but more like Dick's, warm, gentle, and when he smiled, he had a dimple on his left cheek. He moved confidently and calmly, like someone who is used to entering a room and being heard."With a look like his, it doesn't have to be difficult," he thought absently.-----Overworked, without a real love life, and with Dick in full teenage rebellion, the last thing Bruce needs is to have to babysit the powerful alien the Lanterns have brought to the Watchtower.But Kal El has his ways of breaking down all Bruce's barriers.

entry.title: Forgive Yourself by Letting Yourself Love (and letting yourself be loved)
entry.summary:
Author: aviationisthere

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 95,118Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 944

Summary: When Bruce arrived at the cave, the first thing he heard was yelling. That wasn’t unusual so he didn’t think anything was out of the ordinary. That was until he parked Nightwing’s bike in its spot and he saw his children. He saw his children. They were children. Young children. “What the...” Bruce pulled off the helmet. He got off the bike and set the helmet down before pulling off his cowl. He walked over to the batmobile which his kids were trying to climb out of. “Boys?”•OR just another batfam de-aging au because I love them and I wanted one that had all of my demands so I roped my friend Avian into helping me co-write one!

entry.title: With All Due Respect
entry.summary:
Author: BlueGrapefruitSoda

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,163Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 220

Summary: Bruce gave a slight smile, his voice low and curiosity piqued. “You have permission to speak.” Clark shifted uncomfortably, his gaze dropping to the ground. “As someone who’s dedicated his life to your safety and happiness,” he began, his voice quiet but steady, “it matters deeply to me that you choose a partner truly worthy of you — someone who honors your love and your loyalty.” He drew in a slow breath, then lifted his eyes to meet Bruce’s. “And I’m afraid, my prince… the man you’re considering is not that person.”Or Clark is in love with Bruce, the prince he protects and Bruce is oblivious.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,752Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 612

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: Care and Keeping and Kryptonite
entry.summary:
Author: Mild and Hammered (pillage_and_lute)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 103,770Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 1,381

Summary: Mild-mannered junior reporter (and relatively recent superhero) Clark Kent gets his first big job all to himself. When the trail leads him to Gotham and the turf of his ally, and idol, Batman, Clark gets injured in the crossfire, unable to reveal his true identity. He's forced to recuperate at the mansion of Batman's apparent ally, infamous playboy Brucie Wayne. Bruce's kids seem determined to keep Clark in close proximity, thwarting his attempts to either return to his super persona or avoid Wayne's ridiculous flirting. But there's more to the case, and Wayne, than meets the eye.Batman doesn't rescue pretty reporters, that's Superman's schtick, but when a firefight forces Clark Kent of the Daily Planet to recuperate at Wayne Manor, Bruce will just have to manage. Juggling fatherhood and an overbearing public persona is bad enough, but fighting the investigative power of a journalist in his own home could bring down not only his secret identity, but his sons'. He's determined not to give in to the draw of big blue eyes, or, more embarrassingly, to his boys' meddling. And worst of all, no one can find Superman.

entry.title: Two's Company, Three is a Crowd, Four is a Party
entry.summary:
Author: Heylittleguy21

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,681Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 30

Summary: Every machine is made up of smaller, more intricate parts that help the machine function. A cog turns another cog that cog turns another cog which turns another cog. These cogs eventually turn the hands on a clock tower. Even the smallest one is fundamental to the efficiency of the clock tower. For the Justice League, you are that cog. You keep them turning. You keep the public's infallible heroes functioning, you keep them from falling apart. The public may never know your face or your name and they definitely won't know that you're the glue that keeps the Justice League together. The public will never know how essential you are to the Justice League and even more to the "Trinity". Or how you will be. This fic describes how exactly you become a vital part of the Justice League and maybe fall in love along the way.

But it was still a fucking given."Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. entry.title: 𝑪𝑳𝑶𝑺𝑬 𝑸𝑼𝑨𝑹𝑻𝑬𝑹𝑺 // 𝑨 𝑺𝑼𝑷𝑬𝑹𝑩𝑨𝑻 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑹𝒀
entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,834Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 140

Summary: Bruce Wayne is no stranger to the spotlight—or the shadows it casts. Reclusive, haunted by tragedy, and heir to a name that carries more weight than comfort, he now faces something far more personal than public scrutiny: a stalker. The letters arrive like clockwork—taunting, obsessive, familiar. And with Halloween approaching—the anniversary of his parents' death—the tension coils tighter.Clark Kent is a disciplined, quietly intense MMA-trained security specialist, brought in under General Sam Lane’s orders to keep Bruce safe. He expects a job. He doesn’t expect the gothic cold of Wayne Manor, the brooding silence of its only resident, or the unsettling depth of what Bruce refuses to say out loud.But as danger creeps closer, and the mystery surrounding the stalker sharpens, Bruce and Clark are forced into uncomfortable proximity. What begins as resistance slowly becomes something deeper—something fragile and real.
